snippet: Many Japanese have a sense that their country has outgrown an economic template based on constructing commodity goods, but they disagree over what should replace it.
abstract: Many Japanese officials and business leaders fear that the decline of the country's heavily industrialized economy, which has accelerated since the 2011 nuclear accident in Fukushima Prefecture, has raised the prospect of higher energy prices and even power failures; most economists agree that Japan has outgrown an economic template based on manufacturing commodity goods, but they disagree over what should replace it.
lead_paragraph: Many Japanese have a sense that their country has outgrown an economic template based on constructing commodity goods, but they disagree over what should replace it.

headline.seo: Japan Fears 2011 Crises Speed Manufacturing Decline
headline.main: Declining as a Manufacturer, Japan Weighs Reinvention
headline.print_headline: Amid Decline, Japan Weighs A Reinvention
